intro: Camptacra gracilis f. arachnoidea, commonly known as the spider-like camptacra, is a rare and unique variant of the camptacra genus. It is characterized by its delicate, elongated stems and hairy, spider-like inflorescences that give it its common name. This plant is typically found in specific microhabitats, often in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features include small, greenish-white flowers arranged in a branched pattern. Due to its limited distribution and distinctive morphology, it is of interest to botanists and plant enthusiasts alike.
